channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Corey S Powell
item.description: The astronauts aboard the ISS were amazed by the April 8 solar eclipse, just like the rest of us, and went crazy snapping photos from orbit. They got some amazing views of the Moon's shadow sweeping across southern Canada & Maine, seen from 420 km (261 miles) above: https://www.flickr.com/photos/nasa2explore/with/53645140833 #space #eclipse #space #astronomy

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: I recently went to Florence for the first time and ended up writing about Galileo, the city’s greatest scientist–and the stories we tell about him four centuries later. It’s in my latest email newsletter. Read here: https://buttondown.email/carlzimmer/archive/fridays-elk-april-13-2024/ Subscribe here: https://buttondown.email/carlzimmer

item.title: Cian O’Donnell
item.description: Please join us at our online, global workshop on "Dendritic computation, synaptic plasticity & molecular mechanisms"22/23/25 April, each day suits different timezones. ~22 short talks.co-organised by Tatjana Tchumatchenko @tatjanaT and I.Goal is to make links between experimental and computational researchers working on molecular mechanisms of neurons.http://tchumatchenko.de/Workshop/workshop_schedulePage.html

item.title: Florian Aigner
item.description: Die Unterstellung, Wissenschaftler seien von der Pharmalobby/Illuminaten/dunklen Mächten "gekauft" könnte man ja als übertriebene aber rationale Vorsicht vor demokratisch nicht legitimierten Kräften sehen. Bis dieselben Leute Parteien voll ok finden, die von Moskau gekauft sind.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: New software for analyzing imaging data from dendrites, spines, synapses-- calcium, voltage, neurotransmitters. User friendly, GUI-run, full manual in supplement. Segmentation, feature detection, excellent bAP subtraction, tuning, alignment within-session for motion, and across-session registration as well. Runs in MATLAB. Open source. https://doi.org/10.1117/1.NPh.11.2.024307 There are multiple suites for imaging signals from cell bodies-- this one is the most complete suite for subcellular signals I've ever seen. Built from the ground up specifically for this kind of data, and with a ton of tools-- including for calculating tuning curves, spine turnover, etc. Excellent work!

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
New review!
Cognition is an emergent property
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cobeha.2024.101388
Electrical fields in the brain can serve as a medium for propagating activity nearly instantaneously. They can organize computations through subspace coding.
#neuroscience

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
"electric fields...are causally relevant, and...informative."
Why not? They are there. Evolution uses what's availableDecoupling Measurements and Processes: On the Epiphenomenon Debate Surrounding Brain Oscillations in Field Potentials
https://osf.io/preprints/psyarxiv/knjfw
#neuroscience

item.title: Jay Kuo
item.description: Speaker Johnson appears determined to move ahead with Ukraine aid, even as the far-right threatens to oust him and Democrats weigh whether to offer support. It’s a tough road ahead, but as I explain, there’s finally a chance of a Ukraine aid vote getting to the floor. https://open.substack.com/pub/statuskuo/p/threading-the-needle?r=1zr8b&utm_campaign=post&utm_medium=web&showWelcomeOnShare=true

item.title: Matteo Carandini
item.description: Are you interested in how neuronal populations code external and internal signals to drive behavior? Join our lab as a postdoc! We are looking for people with a diverse set of skills, from computational to experimental. Our lab offers a friendly and collaborative environment, and the most advanced techniques. For more information, see https://www.ucl.ac.uk/cortexlab/positions

item.title: Cian O’Donnell
item.description: people often think of spike-timing-dependent plasticity as a millisecond-timescale learning rulebut in STDP experiments the stimulation is repeated ~50 times. this implies two other slower timescales (see pic)turns out these slow factors matter just as much as fast signals. I wrote a review on this and related issues https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0959438823001034

item.title: FocalPlane
item.description:
Multi-Tasking with Multi-Channel LED Illumination
Check out our sponsored post from CoolLED on how their latest LED system, the pE-800, can be used for a wide range of applications including FRET, optogenetics and calcium imaging.
https://focalplane.biologists.com/2023/09/13/working-smarter-with-leds-and-optical-filters-for-widefield-fluorescence/

item.title: Glyn Moody
item.description: #Chemtrail Legislation Is The New Normal In A Severely Abnormal America - https://www.techdirt.com/2024/04/17/chemtrail-legislation-is-the-new-normal-in-a-severely-abnormal-america/ "four years of Trump has resulted in a legislative dynamic where being seriously stupid is not only acceptable, but might actually be the best way to ensure re-election." fine, angry piece about spreading stupidity
